definitions.definition: The hot gaseous form of water , formed when water changes from the liquid phase to the gas phase (at or above its boiling point temperature).
The suspended condensate ( cloud ) formed by water vapour when it encounters colder air

subdefinitions.definition: Exhaled breath into cold air below the dew point of the exhalation

definitions.definition: Pressurized water vapour used for heating , cooking , or to provide mechanical energy .
The act of cooking by steaming .
examples: Give the carrots a ten-minute steam .

definitions.definition: Internal energy for progress or motive power .
examples: After three weeks in bed he was finally able to sit up under his own steam .
Dad had to go outside to blow off some steam .

definitions.definition: Travel by means of a steam-powered vehicle.
Fencing without the use of any electric equipment.

main_definition: The hot gaseous form of water , formed when water changes from the liquid phase to the gas phase (at or above its boiling point temperature).
secondary_definitions: The suspended condensate ( cloud ) formed by water vapour when it encounters colder air
Pressurized water vapour used for heating , cooking , or to provide mechanical energy .
The act of cooking by steaming .
( figuratively ) Internal energy for progress or motive power .
Travel by means of a steam-powered vehicle.
( fencing ) Fencing without the use of any electric equipment.
